{{title|C++14}}
{{cpp/version/navbar}}

C++14 is a minor version after the major version C++11, featuring mainly minor improvements and defect fixes. Its approval was announced on August 18, 2014. It was released on December 15, 2014.

Before its approval, C++1y is sometimes used to indicate its release in 2010s.

{{todo}}

==New language features==
* [[cpp/language/variable template|variable templates]]
* [[cpp/language/lambda|generic lambdas]]
* lambda init-capture
* new/delete elision&lt;!--5.3.4[expr.new]/10 "An implementation is allowed to omit a call..."--&gt;
* [[cpp/language/constexpr|relaxed restrictions on constexpr functions]]
* [[cpp/language/integer literal|binary literals]]
* [[cpp/language/integer literal#Single quote|digit separators]]
* [[cpp/language/function#Return type deduction (since C++14)|return type deduction for functions]]
* [[cpp/language/aggregate initialization|aggregate classes]] with default non-static member initializers.

==New library features== 
* {{lc|std::make_unique}}
* {{lc|std::shared_timed_mutex}} and {{lc|std::shared_lock}}
* {{lc|std::integer_sequence}}
* {{lc|std::exchange}}
* {{lc|std::quoted}}
* and many small improvements to existing library facilities, such as 
** two-range overloads for some algorithms
** type alias versions of type traits
** user-defined literals for {{ltt|cpp/string/basic_string}}, {{ltt|cpp/chrono/duration}} and {{ltt|cpp/numeric/complex}}
** etc.
